title: Mandalay was the 'city of gold' - now it reeks of death
snippets: Residents in Mandalay, Myanmar's second-largest city, speak of despair and sleepless nights since last week's earthquake.
summary: Residents of Mandalay, Myanmar's second-largest city, have been experiencing despair and sleepless nights following an earthquake that occurred last week.
titles: Mandalay was the 'city of gold' - now it reeks of death

title: US prosecutors to seek death penalty for Luigi Mangione
snippets: The 26-year-old is accused of shooting dead healthcare CEO Brian Thompson outside a Manhattan hotel.
summary: A 26-year-old individual has been charged with the murder of healthcare CEO Brian Thompson, who was fatally shot outside a hotel in Manhattan.
titles: US prosecutors to seek death penalty for Luigi Mangione

title: France's far right calls for Paris rally in support of Le Pen
snippets: Marine Le Pen has said a "nuclear bomb" was used against her party to stop it getting into power.
summary: Marine Le Pen claimed that extreme measures, which she described as a "nuclear bomb," were deployed to prevent her party from gaining power.
titles: France's far right calls for Paris rally in support of Le Pen

title: Tourists and residents evacuated as volcano erupts in Iceland
snippets: The Blue Lagoon and the town of Grindavik were ordered to evacuate after earthquakes hit the area.
summary: The Blue Lagoon and the nearby town of Grindavik were evacuated following a series of earthquakes in the area.
titles: Tourists and residents evacuated as volcano erupts in Iceland

title: Putin begins biggest Russian military call-up in years
snippets: Russia calls up 160,000 men aged 18-30 as it moves to expand the size of its military.
summary: Russia has initiated a call-up of 160,000 men aged between 18 and 30 years old, aiming to increase the size of its military forces.
titles: Putin begins biggest Russian military call-up in years

title: Our annual mock draft with 32 first-round trades: Deals for Kirk Cousins, Micah Parsons
snippets: We proposed 32 trades to shake up Round 1, including deals that involve Cousins and Parsons.
summary: A proposal outlines 32 trades aimed at reinvigorating the first round, featuring potential deals involving players Cousins and Parsons.
titles: Our annual mock draft with 32 first-round trades: Deals for Kirk Cousins, Micah Parsons

title: NFL owners table voting on tush push ban pitch
snippets: NFL owners have tabled voting on the Green Bay Packers' proposal to ban the tush push in order to have further discussion.
summary: NFL owners have postponed a vote on a proposal by the Green Bay Packers to prohibit the 'tush push' tactic, deciding to further discuss the matter before making a decision.
titles: NFL owners table voting on tush push ban pitch

title: LaFleur: If Rodgers to Vikings, 'hell of a story'
snippets: While Packers coach Matt LaFleur said Tuesday it would be "a hell of a story" if Aaron Rodgers joined the Vikings, he also said he wasn't going to "constantly think" about it.
summary: Packers coach Matt LaFleur commented on the possibility of Aaron Rodgers joining the Vikings, calling it "a hell of a story." However, he also stated he wouldn't dwell on the idea.
titles: LaFleur: If Rodgers to Vikings, 'hell of a story'

title: Hunter an option for Giants at No. 3, Daboll says
snippets: Colorado star Travis Hunter could be an option for the Giants with the third overall pick in the draft as both a wide receiver and cornerback, coach Brian Daboll said.
summary: Colorado's Travis Hunter is being considered by the New York Giants for the third overall pick in the draft. Coach Brian Daboll highlighted Hunter's versatility, noting his potential to play both as a wide receiver and cornerback.
titles: Hunter an option for Giants at No. 3, Daboll says

title: Messi's bodyguard banned from MLS sidelines
snippets: Lionel Messi's bodyguard Yassine Cheuko has been banned from protecting the Argentine forward from the touchline during Inter Miami matches.
summary: Lionel Messi's bodyguard, Yassine Cheuko, is no longer allowed to serve as Messi's bodyguard from the sidelines during Inter Miami games.
titles: Messi's bodyguard banned from MLS sidelines

title: Starmer prepares for Trump tariffs as trade deal hopes fade
snippets: Business secretary Jonathan Reynolds warns of ‘very serious and significant moment’ for economy
summary: Jonathan Reynolds, the Business Secretary, has issued a warning about a critical and substantial moment facing the economy, highlighting the severity of the current economic challenges.
titles: Starmer prepares for Trump tariffs as trade deal hopes fade

title: EU brandishes ‘strong plan’ to retaliate against US tariffs
snippets: Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen says Brussels could hit Big Tech services exports
summary: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen announced that Brussels is considering measures against Big Tech companies, including potential restrictions on their services exports.
titles: EU brandishes ‘strong plan’ to retaliate against US tariffs

title: Businesses rush goods into US foreign trade zones as tariffs loom
snippets: Policy uncertainty fuels surge in use of approved facilities that temporarily exempt businesses from paying levies
summary: A rise in policy uncertainty has led to an increase in businesses utilizing approved facilities that allow them to temporarily avoid paying certain levies.
titles: Businesses rush goods into US foreign trade zones as tariffs loom

title: Klarna hit by buy now, pay later backlash as it targets $15bn IPO
snippets: Swedish fintech brought ‘pay in four’ to everything from food to fashion but sceptics point to model’s vulnerabilities
summary: A Swedish fintech company has expanded the 'pay in four' installment payment model to various sectors, including food and fashion. However, critics have raised concerns about the potential vulnerabilities of this payment method.
titles: Klarna hit by buy now, pay later backlash as it targets $15bn IPO

title: Ten weeks that shook the world
snippets: On many fronts, and with deliberate haste, America is vaporising its soft power
summary: The United States is rapidly diminishing its influence and appeal globally, known as its soft power, through actions and policies across various domains.
titles: Ten weeks that shook the world

title: New warnings of a 'Butterfly Effect' -- in reverse
snippets: A new study warns that global climate change may have a devastating effect on butterflies, turning their species-rich, mountain habitats from refuges into traps. Think of it as the 'butterfly effect' -- the idea that something as small as the flapping of a butterfly's wings can eventually lead to a major event such as a hurricane -- in reverse. The new study also suggests that a lack of comprehensive global data about insects may leave conservationists and policymakers ill-prepared to mitigate biodiversity loss from climate change for a wide range of insect species.
summary: A recent study indicates that climate change could severely impact butterflies, transforming their diverse mountain habitats from safe havens into deadly traps. This situation highlights a 'reverse butterfly effect,' where minor changes lead to significant negative outcomes. Additionally, the study points out the insufficient global data on insects, which may hinder efforts to prevent biodiversity loss among various insect species due to climate change.
titles: New warnings of a 'Butterfly Effect' -- in reverse

title: New study validates lower limits of human heat tolerance
snippets: Human thermoregulation limits are lower than previously thought, indicating that some regions may soon experience heat and humidity levels exceeding safe limits for survival. The study underscores the urgent need to address climate change impacts on human health, providing vital data to inform public health strategies and climate models.
summary: Recent research reveals that the limits of human thermoregulation are lower than once believed, suggesting imminent risks in certain areas where heat and humidity could surpass levels safe for human survival. This study highlights the pressing need for action on climate change to protect human health and informs strategies and models for public health and climate.
titles: New study validates lower limits of human heat tolerance

title: Clinical trial unearths hidden hypertension with automated searches of health records
snippets: A trial of 648 patients found that the new automated method and intervention strategy resulted in nearly four times as many diagnoses and treatment plans for high blood pressure compared with traditional office-based health care visits.
summary: A study involving 648 patients demonstrated that an automated method and intervention strategy significantly improved the diagnosis and treatment of high blood pressure, yielding nearly four times more diagnoses and treatment plans than traditional office visits.
titles: Clinical trial unearths hidden hypertension with automated searches of health records

title: Discovery of Quina technology challenges view of ancient human development in East Asia
snippets: Researchers have uncovered a complete Quina technological system in the Longtan site in southwest China. The discovery challenges the widely held perception that the Middle Paleolithic period was mostly static in East Asia.
summary: Researchers have discovered a complete Quina technological system at the Longtan site in southwest China, challenging the belief that the Middle Paleolithic period in East Asia was largely unchanging.
titles: Discovery of Quina technology challenges view of ancient human development in East Asia

title: Study shows groundwater gains in Arizona yet climate risks still threaten water supply
snippets: A combination of water management practices has contributed to notable groundwater gains in Central Arizona despite the region dealing with long-term water stress, according to a new study.
summary: A new study has found that improved water management practices have led to significant increases in groundwater levels in Central Arizona, a region that has been facing long-term water stress.
titles: Study shows groundwater gains in Arizona yet climate risks still threaten water supply
